etymology.description: 疒(疒) (nì, "sickness") provides meaning for illness, 疒 + 丙(丙) (bǐng, "fire") as phonetic -> illness
etymology.interpretation: The character 病(bìng) combines the sickness radical 疒 to denote illness, with 丙 adding a phonetic value. 丙 also signifies fire, suggesting symptoms like fever, reinforcing the concept of lying ill.

examples.chinese: 我不想传染病(我不想傳染病)，所以我呆在家里(所以我呆在家裡)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ bù xiǎng chuánrǎn bìng, suǒyǐ wǒ dāi zài jiālǐ.
examples.english: I don't want to catch a disease, so I stay at home.

examples.chinese: 他得了重病(他得了重病)，需要马上治疗(需要馬上治療)。
examples.pinyin: Tā dé le zhòng bìng, xūyào mǎshàng zhìliáo.
examples.english: He contracted a serious illness and needs immediate treatment.
